title.rendered: 6 Steps to Pitching Marketing Automation Software

content.rendered:
[vc_row el_class=”overflow”][vc_column width=”1/2″ offset=”vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-sm-offset-0 vc_col-xs-12″ css=”.vc_custom_1573234281446{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 0px !important;padding-right: 10% !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}”]

Real strategies and examples to help you close the deal

[vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1515477815518{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}”]Every client is different, so your pitch should always be customized to fit the client’s individual needs. SharpSpring partner Blue Wheel Media has identified six simple yet important steps for effectively pitching marketing automation to clients. In this issue of Agency Perspectives, you will:[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class=”list-unstyled list-chevron sm-hide”]

  • Hear about a client who saw a 296% increase in qualified leads
  • Learn how to tailor your demo and strategy to fit your prospects’ specific business needs
  • Find out how to manage clients’ expectations for marketing automation software

[/vc_column_text]

Chase Bertrand

Blue Wheel Media

``Your prospects are more than capable of purchasing and implementing a marketing automation platform themselves. It’s your job to convince them that without your knowledge and expertise, they won’t get very far.``

What is 'Agency Perspectives'?
[vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1515477897129{padding-right: 5em !important;}” el_class=”sm-hide”]Agency Perspectives lets you hear directly from other agencies about how they are using marketing automation to create higher value relationships, build monthly recurring revenue, and prove value to clients.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″ el_class=”m-t-minus-25-percent” offset=”vc_col-lg-5 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12″][vc_column_text]
